intro: Ranunculus caroli-frederici, commonly known as the Carolus-Fredericus buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers with numerous petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with palmately divided leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, making it a notable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
